thread.title: Another candidate joines the gubernatorial race — 5 things you don't need to know but might want to
thread.title_full: Another candidate joines the gubernatorial race — 5 things you don't need to know but might want to

author: Angela Mueller
title: Another candidate joines the gubernatorial race — 5 things you don't need to know but might want to
text: Another candidate joines the gubernatorial race — 5 things you don't need to know but might want to Jul 13, 2015, 6:59am CDT BILL GREENBLATT Standing in 96 degree heat, Missouri Lt. Gov. Peter Kinder announces he will seek the… more 1. Missouri Lt. Gov. Peter Kinder has announced that he is running for governor, joining three other Republicans in the gubernatorial primary. 2. Chaminade basketball player Jayson Tatum , the No. 2 rated player in the nation by ESPN.com, announced Sunday on ESPNU that he will be attending Duke University after finishing his senior year at Chaminade. 3. Illinois has authorized the first two marijuana cultivation centers in the state to begin growing the state's first legal marijuana crops. Preliminary licenses were issued to 18 cultivation centers in March, and more of those centers are expected to receive the official green light to begin growing pot in the coming days.
